evals.name: AI Engineer Learning GenAI
evals.description: Test skill with intermediate AI engineer wanting to learn production GenAI techniques

user_input.primary_goal: Learn production techniques and best practices

success_criteria: Schedule includes keynote on March 16
At least 2 workshops recommended from March 15 offerings
Sessions balanced between core interests (GenAI, LLMs) and supporting areas (hardware, deployment)
Networking/booth time explicitly scheduled
Clear rationale provided for session selections
Backup options given for high-demand sessions

evals.name: Executive Scouting Agentic AI Opportunities
evals.description: Test skill with a VC/executive with limited time (2-3 days) scouting for opportunities

user_input.preferences: Survey of topics, high networking, executive briefings
user_input.constraints: Limited time, need flexibility for meetings

expected_outputs.format: Condensed 2-day itinerary with more white space

success_criteria: Schedule acknowledges limited 2-day availability
Keynote (March 16) is primary anchor event
Topics span stated interests without overwhelming detail
Significant unstructured time for spontaneous networking
Includes recommendation for 'Connect with Experts' sessions
Suggests which booths/demos are must-sees
Format is executive-friendly (brief, actionable)

evals.name: Student Exploring ML and Robotics
evals.description: Test skill with student wanting broad exposure and career guidance

user_input.primary_goal: Explore ML/AI careers and learn from experts
user_input.preferences: Mix of beginner-friendly sessions and hands-on workshops, heavy networking

success_criteria: Recommends 2-3 beginner-focused boot camps
Balance of breadth (survey multiple topics) vs. depth
Includes 'Connect with the Experts' sessions recommendations
Highlights free/included networking events
Suggests career-focused sessions or panels
Recommends which booths have internship/job opportunities
Explains why each recommendation matters for career
Includes rest/break time (students often overcommit)

evals.name: Conflict Resolution - Overlapping Sessions
evals.description: Test skill's ability to handle conflicts and recommend prioritization

user_input.preferences: Deep dives, willing to skip some sessions for quality
user_input.special_request: What if two of my top interests have overlapping sessions? How would you prioritize?

success_criteria: Clearly identifies the conflict in provided schedule
Provides reasoning for which session to prioritize
Offers concrete backup/alternative sessions
Explains trade-offs (what you'd miss vs. what you'd gain)
Provides 2-3 alternative scheduling options
Suggests watching recordings if available post-conference

evals.name: Hardware-Focused Engineer
evals.description: Test skill with GPU/systems engineer wanting deep hardware knowledge

user_input.primary_goal: Learn latest GPU capabilities and optimization techniques
user_input.preferences: Technical depth, less interest in business/enterprise talks

success_criteria: Recommends boot camps on CUDA optimization
Includes expert-level hardware sessions
Emphasizes hands-on labs and technical workshops
Most sessions front-loaded to morning slots
Includes hardware keynote/announcement times
Suggests booth demos with detailed hardware specs
Recommends expert connect sessions with NVIDIA hardware engineers
Includes GPU architecture deep-dives

evaluation_config.scope: Create mode - testing skill's ability to generate personalized itineraries
evaluation_config.success_threshold: At least 80% of success criteria met per eval
notes: Each eval tests different user persona and goal
Tests both simple (AI engineer) and complex (executive) scenarios
Includes conflict resolution and edge cases
Success depends on: clear schedule, aligned recommendations, realistic constraints
